key_points: Facebook experienced a massive outage that started around 8:30 a.m. PT/11:30 a.m. ET on Monday.
The outage has reportedly cost Facebook at least $60 million in lost revenue.
Revenue loss was estimated by Fortune and Snopes using Facebook's second-quarter earnings report.
Facebook generates approximately $319.6 million in revenue per day.
The financial impact is significant given Facebook's reliance on its ad business.
Facebook acknowledged the outage and stated its teams are working to restore services.
Services began to come back online by approximately 3:30 p.m. PT/6:30 p.m. ET on the same day.
Facebook apologized for the inconvenience and expressed gratitude for users' patience.
Shares of Facebook dropped nearly 5%, reducing CEO Mark Zuckerberg's net worth and ranking.
The outage also led to a broader selloff in social media stocks, affecting shares of Twitter and Snap.
